Desc: A perfect chance to witness the spectacle of the sky-high; snow clad peaks of the Annapurna region.  A chance to intermingle with the ethnic populations that populate the Annapurna region.  A short yet sweet journey to get away from the hustle and bustle of daily life and explore dramatic panoramic profiles that Nepal boasts.

Witness the views and explore the base camp of the mighty Everest Amalgamate with ethnic populations residing all through the Khumbu region. Unveil the mystery of Khumbu region by passing through an off-beaten path. Highest altitude covered is the Kalapathhar (5545m) The opportunity to witness the views of the highest peak in the world is surely a thrilling experience. Mix it in with the chance to trek to the Base Camp of Everest (8848m), and you have to yourself, the Everest Base Camp Trek.

Manaslu Tsum valley trekÂ is one of the Nepalâ€™s Himalayan charms to observe a dazzling collection of panoramas, peak and serene valleys. The trekkers who trek to the Manaslu and Tsum region will take pleasure in a marvelous array of geographical landscapes and cultural diversity.Manaslu Tsum valley trek can explore wildernessÂ and get opportunity to explore the local culture of the traditional villages of Samagaon and Samdo and observe the lifestyle of Tibetan people.Tsum valley was only opened for trekkers few years ago and the trail traverses through pristine areas where you will witness the beauty of nature than any other places. This trek suits best to those who are looking for the challenging Treking in Nepal and it is also a part of the Great Himalayan trail.Â Manaslu Tsum valley trekÂ is a magical enchantment of the Treking which presents the awe-inspiring views of Manaslu and hidden Tsum valley.Â Day 1: Arrive at Kathmandu airport (1,302m/4,270ft)

Explore the wild west of Nepal Himalaya to Upper Mustang in the company ofÂ View Nepal TreksÂ expert guidance.Â Upper Mustang Trek located on the far North West Himalaya in between Dolpo area and North of Annapurna and Dhaulagiri mountain range. Trip Highlights: Ancient caravan trade route to Tibet with incredible sceneries Mustang located on an extension of Tibetan high and vast plateau. Exploring ancient Bon / Buddhist cultures of Tibetan origin Treking to former forbidden kingdom around walled village at Lo-Manthang. This fascinating Upper Mustang trek involves a scenic flight to and from picturesque Pokhara city and Jomsom, the headquarter town of Mustang region.Â The Upper Mustang trek brings you into the hidden world of the old Buddhist kingdom ofÂ Mustang Region.

An adventurous and fascinating journeyÂ  Langtang Valley TrekÂ in a complete wilderness in the company and guidance of View Nepal Treks with its expert guides and staff. Treking with amazing Langtang Â Valley, Himalayan ranges, and local cultures are major attractions of this Langtang Region. Trip Highlights Around beautiful Langtang valley enclosed with high mountains, Exploring old heritage and Buddhist culture of Tamang and Hylamo tribes, Adventure from Langtang to Helambu crossing high picturesque Ganaja-la pass, An adventure to fascinating destinations around Mid North West/East Himalaya. This fabulous adventure Langtang Valley trek leads you to observe awesome scenery in the midst of giant mountain range of Langtang Lirung, Langtang II, Kimshun, Dorji Lakpa and Naya KangaÂ / GanjalaÂ peak.

TheÂ Annapurna Base CampÂ is a high glacial basin lying 40Â km directly north ofÂ Pokhara. This oval-shaped plateau sits at an altitude of over 4000 metersÂ and is surrounded by a ring of mountains, theÂ AnnapurnaÂ range, most of which are over 7000 meters. It is a classic trek to Annapurna base camp situated under the immense south face of Annapurna. The trek passes through the middle hills of Nepal with Gurung villages and forests of oak, magnolia and rhododendron. The trail then follows the Modi Khola River into the Sanctuary where you enter a hidden amphitheatre with a superb view of snowy peaks. This is not particularly difficult trek although there are some steep climbs and a few narrow bridges. It is a good a trek to do if you would like to get into the high Himalayas without the longer acclimatization period required for some of the other trek. The highest altitude reached is 4,130m at Annapurna Base Camp.Â Â Trek facts:

P_Name: Recently Open Manaslu Circuit Tea House Trek by Local Guide
Desc: For this Trip you need to be physically fitness and mentally well prepare.Â  Some days you need to walk 8 to 9 hours, which is more than average walking in a day. It could do just Camping organize trip last three years ago but there is basic Teahouse entire trip now a days.Â  Mostly, you will stay in Lodge and having food same place (Dhal Bhat=main Nepali food, Fried rice, Bread, Boiled and fried eggs, Potato, Noodles, porridge, tea coffee tec.)Â  But if you have additional some days you may visit Tsum Valley area also, this is home stay trip (where you can have the food there at someone house and provide accommodation). If you have time, I would like recommend you Tsum Valley too; which is itself restricted area and open since 2007.Â Â  This trip is combination of cultural and religious, which is a unique trip among numbers Treking trail of the Nepal.Â This trip is combination of unique cultural and religious, which is a unique trip among numbers Treking trail of the Nepal.Â

Desc: If you are looking for a newly opened and untouched route in Nepal then, Mardi Himal Trek is best suited for you. Officially opened in 2012, this trek is a combination of both adventure and serenity. Completed within 5-10 days (with basic tea-house or camping), Mardi Himal Trek offers the trekkers the dramatic panoramas of Mardi Himal, Annapurna, Machhapuchre and Himchuli ranges. It is an assorted trek that makes the trekkers experience the beauty of flora and fauna along the route, walk via verdant forests, massive landscapes, eye catching Himalayan peaks and Rhododendron forests.

On April 25, 2015, a massive 7.8 magnitude earthquake, also recognized as the Gorkha Earthquake, hit Nepal without caution. Killing 9,000 people and harming more than 23,000, it is the most awful natural disaster to happen in the country since 1934. Followed by a 7.3 magnitude earthquake on May 12, almost 400 after-shocks, and still counting, Nepal sustained a major setback caused by the loss of people and property. Rebuild Gorkha Trek is an opportunity for benevolent people to volunteer in the earthquake affected areas of Gorkha district including Barpak, the epicenter of 2015 Nepal Earthquake.

Wild people with wilder thought once visit Nepal to experience the heart pounding thrill of plunging off a suspension bridge above river canyon. The one word "Courage" is needed to get un-forgettable memories for life-time. The ultimate thrill of a bungee jump is now experienced at Tatopani, Nepal-Tibet border, it is 3-hours bus ride from Kathmandu.The Gorge

Nepal has the ability to provide you with any type of trek suitable for you depending on the length of trek and the motive. Among all those, Everest Base Camp trekÂ falls under top Treking destinations in the world, providing you with life-altering and magnificent Himalayan experiences. The two base camps of the highest mountain on earth are located each on Nepal and Tibet. The South base camp lies on Nepal whereas the North base camp lies on Tibet. â€œYour attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitudeâ€ as said by a famous person, people loving high altitude crave to reach a maximum height. Everest base camp on the South is located at an altitude of 5380 meters (17,600 feet). Reaching this altitude is not difficult if you are fit and have a strong determination to reach your destination.

Breathtaking view of Himalayas including Annapurna, Manaslu, Langtang, Ganesh Himal,Dorge Lanpa, Gaurisankar etc Explore Newari Culture, Temples, and life style of people Engage many out door activities like Zip flying, Paraglyding,Pony Riding,etc Valeshwor Temple, Statue of Great King Prithivi Narayan Shah, Shopping etc Chandragiri day hiking in the rim of Kathmandu valley is the pleasant trip for every nature lovers. It is newly introduced tourism destination. Feel like enchanting oasis right outside the from Kathmandu city. You have many ways to get in Chandragiri Hill and the most pilgrims follows two ways cable car from Bottom to top. However, We have designed this trip to Chandragiri is quite differently, following the interesting nature trails.
locality: Himalayan Smile Treks & Adventures - Chandragiri Day Hiking,18552755071

Desc: The main attraction of Everest Three Passes TrekÂ are the three passes â€“ Renjo La (5,446m), Cho La (5,420m) and KongmaÂ La Pass (5,535m).Â  Though it is a very strenuous trek, itÂ guarantees the exhilarating experience of adventure, perseverance, and excitement. P_Name: Everest Base Camp Cho La Pass Trek
Desc: The Gokyo Cho La Pass Treking provides the numerous opportunities to witness the Himalayan range. The glacial lake, Sherpa community culture, glacial rivers and alpine forests are the highlights of the Everest region. Furthermore, the Gokyo Cho La Pass Treking presents the trailers for the peak climbing as well. The aspiring trekkers who are searching for the high altitude madness and wilderness in the bulk of snow comprising of the glacial river and lake, the Gokyo Ri Trek is the best destination to relish that dream. This trek starts from the adventurous flight up to the Lukla from Kathmandu. The majestic mountain range view along the flight would take away all your monotonous and drabness of your life. The Lukla is the gateway to the majestic Mount Everest and most of the trekkers.

Desc: Heaven is in the earth. The Everest Gokyo Lakes trek would take you to the paradise look alike places. Moreover, Gokyo Lakes trek is one of the fascinating places to experience the heaven on earth. PeregrineÂ Treks takes you to this amazing land via Gokyo Lakes Trek package; guided by the experienced member of Sherpaâ€™s, Porters and Guides. The trail consisting of the yak herds and the road less travelled piercing through the Sherpa community would lead you up there in the lake residing proudly beside Mount Everest. In addition, the trip to the Gokyo Lakes trek itself is an adventurous journey. It would be highlighted with the magnificent flight time to one of the world amazing and scariest airport of Lukla.

P_Name: Nagarkot Sunrise and Full Day Hiking From Kathmandu
Desc: ExperienceÂ your one of the best full day Nagarkot guided trek and amazing sunrise views from Kathmandu in a day.Â  Early in the morning about 5 O'clock your guide will take you to Nagarkot for sunrise and will start your hoking after the Himalayas breakfast. Nagarkot Offer breathtaking Himalayas views including Mount Everest on a clear day.Nagarkot is the fascinating destination for tourists as it posses cultural significance and natural scenic beauty This place is absolutely uninfluenced naturally as well as traditionally with the modernization of Kathmandu valley. The local people here still live in traditional three-storeyed houses wearing their traditional dresses following the traditional way of agriculture in the terraced field. We shall explore a wide area of the Nagarkot having beautiful natural scenery on this day hike around Kathmandu. The great Himalayan panorama of the shimmering snowy peaks begins our trek from Nagarkot hill station situated at the elevation of 2100m.

Desc: Despite its spectacular mountain views and picturesque villages, Kakani is a part of Nepal that most travelers miss. Discover the under-the-radar hilltop hub during this scenic Kathmandu Valley excursion, which includes a mini-trek through pine forests. Taste the regionâ€™s famous food specialtyâ€”rainbow troutâ€”and homemade rhododendron-flavored liquors. Youâ€™ll also village a local Buddhist monastery and a Tamang village.8:30am: Our experienced tour guide picks you up from your hotel. Start the drive from Kathmandu city in a private vehicle to Rani Pauwa takes about 1 hour, which is about 29 kms or 18 miles from the city.
Day 1 :Â  Drive to Sundarijal ( 1 hour) and Trek to Chisapani. 2300 meters. 5 hours. Day 2 : Trek to Nagarkot. 6 hours. Day 3 :Trek to Changu (3 hours) and drive back to Kathmandu.

P_Name: Nagarkot Full-Day Hiking Tour from Kathmandu
Desc: Hike fromÂ Changu Narayan Temple toÂ Nagarkot on a full-day tour from Kathmandu that provides aÂ memorable experience of rural Nepal. Your guide leads you on a walk that takes you fromÂ UNESCO World Heritage-listed Changu Narayan, and through small villages and scenic countryside. Soak inÂ sweepingÂ views of the HimalayasÂ during yourÂ moderately challenging hike, which takes aboutÂ four hours.Â EatÂ lunch at a restaurant near Nagarkot, and have free time before watching the sunset over the mountains.Â Includes guide, and hotel pick-up and drop-off.Following a hotel pick up at 7:30am, you will be transferred to Sankhu/ Changunarayan by a private car.Â Nagarkot is located in Bhaktapur District at an altitude of 2170m, 32 km far from the heart of Kathmandu.You will reach Sankhu/ Changunarayan temple around 9am. Start hiking from Sankhu to Nagarkot for 3 to 4-hours, about 4km uphill. Hike through Telkot Village to see panoramic views of mountains from Nagarkot including Manaslu, Ganesh Himal, Annapuna, and the Langtang mountain ranges. Witness the local lifestyle as you watch people grazing their cattles. Arrive at Nagarkot at around 2pm.

P_Name: Nagarkot and Changu Narayan Hiking Tour from Kathmandu
Desc: Swap the colorful chaos of Kathmandu for serene, snow-capped landscapes and pine-scented forests. During this rugged hike from Nagarkot to the UNESCO-listed temple of Changu Narayan, youâ€™ll pass terraced farms and tiny Tamang and Newari villages. Inside the pagoda-style temple, get a peek at Nepalâ€™s oldest stone inscriptions. The tour includes a hearty local lunch, private transport from Kathmandu, and your own all-day guide.

P_Name: Nagarkot Sunrise View and Day Hiking from Kathmandu
Desc: Nagarkot is a culturally-rich mountain resort in Nepal, famous for its sunrise views over the Himalayan mountain range. During this exhilarating tour from Kathmandu, youâ€™ll enjoy an early morning panorama over world-renowned peaks before setting off on a scenic hike to Changu Narayan. Discover local Newari and Tamang villages as you make your way through the countryâ€™s picturesque hillsides before arriving at the UNESCO-listed temple.Overlooking the snow-topped peaks of the mighty Himalayas, the mountain resort of Nagarkot is on every visitorâ€™s must-see list. But most tours end there, meaning tourists miss out on exploring the picturesque and culturally-rich surrounding regions.

Desc: You need to start this Langtang Gosaikunda Treking from the Syaprubeshi of Rasuwa district. You reach there via bus after 8 to 9hrs of the thrilling ride and from Syaprubeshi the walking trail starts. After the first night spent in Syaprubeshi, your walk begins through the forests alongside the ever-flowing Langtang River. Finally, the trek takes a rest in Lama Hotel, this place is very mystique. And it seems to be a hidden forest camp, us towards trek then passes by the Ghoda Tabela and then the thus towards the barren place of Langtang Valley. Subsequently, you can reach Kyanjin Gompa further 3Â hours of walking. The place offers magnificent views of mountains like Langtang Lirung, Langtang glacier, Yala, Kang, Tsergo Ri etc.Day 01:Â  Arrival in Tribhuvan International Airport, Kathmandu (1300m/4264ft)

Manaslu Circuit TrekÂ is more or less regarded as a remote and unspoiled trek with spectacular views of Mount Manaslu; placed east of the Annapurna Himalayan range.Â The name Manaslu refers "The Spirit-Mountainâ€. According to the local language, it refers to be the generous and strong deity that dwells within. This trek roughly circles the worldâ€™s eighth highest mountain Manaslu (8,163 m); thus, becoming popular Treking trailÂ for the travelers as other famous Treking trails like Everest, Annapurna,Â LangtangÂ and so on. The Nepalese Government only permitted Treking of this circuit in 1992, hence, has been open to organized Treking parties only.

Desc: YouÂ  will get opportunity to experience of Dharma (Good action), yoga (meditation) and learn the knowledge of morality and our duties with sage. You can enjoy with beautiful scenery and views of Kathmandu valley from the height.

Desc: Budhanilkantha temple & monastery Nagi Gompa and Nuns Bird watching heaven Monkey and wild boar observation Tamang people and culture living around outskirt Shivapuri Peak (2730M) Panoramic view from Shivapuri Peak Birds eye view of Kathmandu Shivapuri day hiking is one of the best outdoor activities inside the Kathmandu valley.Probably this is listed as best outdoor in the valley. It is lying in the Shivapuri National Park zone, occupied 159 Km square, while the national park protects endangered red panda, wild boar and many rare bio diversities including flora and fauna. Shivapuri hiking trails in the Shivapuri National Park, northern part of the Kathmandu valley.The hike can be started many places however the most people like to start the hike from Budanilkantha. The trail Shivapuri is well maintained by the army, most of the route paved by the stone so you have less possibility to lose your way too. Walking after half an hour, you will reach Nagi Gumba (2330m) which is a Buddhist meditation center. Observe the Buddhist monastery, school and lifestyle and amazing view of Kathmandu valley. Passing the Nagi Gumba, the trail constantly goes upwards to the Shivapuri Peak (2730m). It is one of the highest hills in Kathmandu valley, offering a panoramic view of Gaurishankar, Langtang, Ganesh Himal andÂ Â Manaslu range.
locality: Himalayan Smile Treks & Adventures - Chandragiri Day Hiking,18552755071

Desc: 12 Days Annapurna Base Camp trek, a Customize Treking Package for those who has limitedÂ  time but like to cover Poonhiil and Annpurna Base Camp. Being at the base camp of worldâ€™s 10th tallest mountain is really a feat to achieve at least once in a lifetime. Moreover, Mt. Annapurna is the spiritual mountain worshiped by the locals referring it as goddess of harvesting. The significant importance of mountain is high as its altitude and hosts best touristic activities that ever happen in Nepal. Annapurna Base Camp Trek is journey which takes trekkers to stupendous place where splendors of nature are in abundance. Bonus things to experience at such place are opportunity to witness culture and traditions of Gurung, Magar & Tibetan communities. CLOTHING

The journey to Annapurna Base Camp (ABC) will start from Kathmandu. On arrival day, you enjoy Nepalese cultural dinner along with cultural dance program at evening.Â Then, in 30 minutes flight you reach Pokhara and drive for 2 hours to Shivahi. Your trek starts from here to hot spring. You have to show your Treking permit and TIMS in the National Park Office. You trail slightly towards hot spring, Jhinu Dada. The total trip will be of 10 days.ABC Treking, also known asÂ Annapurna Sanctuary TrekingÂ is the prominent Treking in Nepal. It offers life time experience of typical Nepali culture, chance to explore local village, local people and their way of living traditional life in Himalaya of Nepal. You get to see lovely view of mountains and during the trek you pass through spectacular landscapes, charming Gurung and Magar villages, lush green Rhododendron, bamboo and alpine forests to the tripâ€™s last and final destination.Day 1:Â Arrive in Kathmandu (ALT 1400 m)

The Island peak climbingÂ (6,160m/20,209ft) is also recognized as Imja Tse Peak among a local which is the most popular Treking peak in Everest region. The peak was first ascended by the team of Britain in 1953. After that many group and people climbed this peak of Nepal.You will see the glory of the Khumbu region passing by the Sherpa inhabited area of Lukla, Phakding, Namche Bazaar & Tengboche.Â  The ascending of the peakÂ offers the captivating vistas of the panoramic Himalayan Mountains of Solukhumbu region including Mt. Everest 8848m, Mt. Lhotse 8516m, Mt. Makalu 8463m, Mt. Cho Oyu 8201 and 27 snow-capped mountain of Everest Treking region as well as glaciers and majestic lake Imja Se from the Island peak.Â Trek Facts:Maximum Altitude: 6,160m/20,209ftTotal Duration: 21 daysTrip Style: Camping, TeahouseGrade: StrenuousHighlights:

P_Name: Expedition at the apex of Mera Peak
Desc: Mera Peak (6,461m/21,190 ft) is the highest Treking peak in Nepal. The mountain is in the Mahalangur section, Barun sub-section of the Himalaya and located in Nepalâ€™s Sagarmatha Zone, Solukhumbhu District.It is an adventurous peak surrounded by snowcapped Himalayan range, and the scenic views including the worldâ€™s 8000-meter peaks: Mount Everest, Lhotse, Cho Oyu, Makalu, and Kanchenjunga.Mera Peaks has three summits: Mera North, 6,476 meters (21,247 ft); Mera Central, 6,461 meters (21,198 ft); and Mera South, 6,065 meters (19,898 ft) as well as a smaller Treking summit which is visible from the south of Nepal. Trek Facts: Maximum Altitude: 6,461 m/21197 ft Total Duration: 21 days Grade: Strenuous Â Trip Highlights:

Desc: The Kopra Ridge is a serene trails of Annapurna region butÂ offering remarkable views of the Himalayas including Dhaulagiri, Annapurna South, Fang and Nilgiri.Â It is one of the most exotic and interesting trek routes in Annapurna region. This trek contains all of the elements of a classic Nepal Treking experience including villages, wildlife, panoramic mountain views and range of landscape from forest to high alpine.Trek Facts:Maximum Altitude: 3,660 m/12,007 ftBest Season: March-May, September-NovemberGrade: ModerateTotal Duration: 14 daysTrip HighlightsKathmandu valley sightseeing;Scenic drive to PokharaMagnificent mountains view of Annapurna, Dhaulagiri andÂ many peaksSunrise view and terraced fieldsExplore beautiful Gurung and Magar villagesWalk through forests and meadowYouÂ might encounter with musk deer, pheasant,red fox andÂ can see Dzo grazing in the fieldsÂ Day 1: Arrive at Kathmandu airport (1,302m)Day 2: Kathmandu valley sightseeingÂ Day 3: Kathmanduâ€“ Pokhara (895m) 25 mins flight â€“ Nayapul (1,074m) 1hr drive â€“ Birethati (1,025m) 30mins hikeTakeÂ scenic flight to Pokhara.Â Drive from PokharaÂ to Nayapul. Further trek down the hillÂ to BirethatiÂ Day 4: Birethati â€“ Ghandruk village (1,970m) 5hrs hikeStart to ascend uphill to Ghandruk passing through rhododendron and oak forest. After 3 hrs hike we reach Kimche for lunch. Continue to climb further higher until we will reach unusual oval shaped houses and stoned streets . Stay overnight in lodge.Day 5: Ghandruk â€“ Tadapani (2,590m) 5 hrs hikeWeÂ continue upwards through Bheri kharka and stop here for lunch. We continue to trek into the rhododendron forest and over a small pass to Tadapani. Walking uphill, we will reach the village of Tadapani where we stay overnight here.Day 6: Tadapani â€“ Bayeli Kharka (3,420m) 7 hours hikeWeÂ trekÂ through forest following a trail originally used by villagers from Ghandruk.Â Start to ascend above the tree line and follows a ridge to Deurali and continues up to Bayeli KharkaÂ  A clear view of Mt. Dhaulagiri can be seen to the west of the lodge.Day 7: Bayeli Kharka â€“ Upper Chistibung (2,975m) 4hrs trekTrek on a grassy slope and passes through numerous herdersâ€™ huts and Dzo grazing in the fields. If youâ€™re lucky you might spot beautiful Daphe pheasant, the national bird of Nepal as well the Himalayan Tahr high above the trail.Â Day 8: Upper Chistibung â€“ Kopra Ridge (3,660m) 4hrs trekWeÂ trek through steady ascent alpine meadows once you reach at ridgeÂ enjoyÂ the full panorama of Mt. Dhaulagiri and Nilgiri, Fang and Annapurna south can also be seenDay 9: Day hike from Kopra RidgeToday we haveÂ option for a day hikeÂ  towards Kaire Lake, As it might take 11 hours to reach there and return back. Or one can join another half day hike.Â Return back to the lodge at Kopra RidgeDay 10: Kopra Ridge â€“ Swanta Village (2,200m) 5hrs hikeContinuing our trek we descend further downwards to Swanta Village. Views of Mt. Dhaulagiri can be seen through the trail providing a lovely backdrop to the terraced fields and traditional housesÂ Â Day 11: Swanta Village â€“ Ulleri (1,309m) 7hours hikeWeÂ descend to Ulleri, walking down for few minutesÂ and join the main trail to GhorepaniÂ walking downhill through rhododendron forest to UlleriÂ Day 12: Ulleriâ€“ Nayapul â€“Pokhara, approx 4 hrs trekWeÂ join the trail that descends downhill all the way to Birethati. Drive back to Pokhara from NayapulDay 13: Fly back to KathmanduDay 14:Â  Back home

This incredible trek in the Everest region is not just a thrilling trip but also a picturesque trek. It is one of the classic treks of the world as it trails to Everest Base Camp followed by Cho LaÂ (5,380m/17,650ft) and Renjo La (5,388m/17,513ft) passes.Â  The trek starts from Lukla heading towards Namche bazaar,Â whilst encounter authentic Sherpa cultureÂ  and the warm hospitality of the families of inborn mountaineers.Â You will be in Buddhist Sherpa territory where you will see colorful prayer flags, Buddhist chanting in the walls and monastery.Trek Facts:Maximum Altitude: 5,545 m/18,192 ftBest Season: Sep- Dec/ March- JunTrip Grade: StrenuousTotal Duration: 22 daysHighlights:

This package combinesÂ fourÂ of Nepal's most fascinatingÂ  Buddhist and Hindu religious sitesÂ in the outskirt of Kathmandu Valley, which takes about 5 to 6 hours hiking.Â Travel toÂ  Budhanilkantha, the start of your hiking point, where youâ€™ll visit the sacred site of sleeping Hindu deity Vishnu, followed by hiking toÂ  Chunikhel village, mostly inhabited by the Newar community. Hike toÂ  Kapan MonasteryÂ andÂ  Pullahari MonasteryÂ and finish the hike by visitingÂ  Gokarneshwor MahadevÂ Temple. All of these sites provideÂ majestic hilltop location, offering magnificent views of Kathmandu Valley.

Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing in major places with tour guide2. Sightseeing in the beautiful Pokhara Valley with boating in Phewa Lake3. Panoramic View of Mt. Nilgiri, Mt. Annapurna and Mt. Dhaulagiri4. Buddhist heritage of the â€˜Forbidden Kingdomâ€™ to the legendary walled city of Lo Manthang.5. Old Trans-Himalayan trading route towards Tibet6. A three day hiking from Kathmandu to Nagarkot via Chisapani would be your best natural walk around Kathmandu valley. Kathmandu valley is known for the green hills. People would like to walk through these hills while they visit in Nepal. This tour activity starts with a ride to Sundarijal, which is the hike start point. Approx. 4-5 hour hike will take you to Chisapani. It's a hill top Tamang village with landscape view of Nuwakot district and Langtang mountain range. The next day you will hike to Nagarkot via Lapsephedi and Jarsingh Pouwa. Nagarkot is also known for the sunset and sunrise view. One can see the Mount Everest from Nagarkot hill top. March, April, October and November is the best season to experience this hiking trail.It's a three day hike/trek. Our guide will meet you at your hotel early in the morning (7 AM) on trek day. Guide will give you show brief about the hike/trek. After your breakfast you will drive (8:30 AM) towards Sundarijal via Boudhanath. Sundarijal is the hike start point. Your hike/trek area lies within the Shivapuri - Nagarjun national park. You have to register and pay your entrance fee while entering from Sundarijal. After 30 minutes uphill walk, you will see some beautiful fountains. This hike is a complete nature and Jungle walk. More the half way you have to pass through the Jungle.Â Day 1: Drive to Sundarijal on private vehicle (60 Minutes from Kathmandu City Center), start your trek to Chisapani (4 - 5 hours). Overnight at Chisapani. Accommodation will be at local lodge. You will have your lunch and dinner at Chisapani.

9 Days Ghorepani Poon hill Treking into the Annapurna region is a relatively easy hiking with some great mountain views and experiencing local culture and traditions. Trekkers get to observe majestic views of the snow-capped mountains like Annapurna South, Machhapuchhre, Himalchuli and many more.This is easy Treking that strolls aroundÂ the astounding villages of the Annapurna Region. Trek throughÂ blooming Rhododendron forest. This Poon Hill Treking in Nepal will endow you with the Himalayan Panorama. Nevertheless, it bestows you the opportunities to get up close and personal with the local Culture. However, Ghorepani Poon Hill Treking is prominent for the sunrise view from Poon Hill.

P_Name: Scenic Everest Experience Mountain Flight Tour from Kathmandu
Desc: Enjoy your Scenic Everest Experience Mountain Flight tour from Kathmandu, take you up as close as to where you can view the snowy peaks from your prime viewing window and also within camera range of some of the highest summits in the world. Provide you with an opportunity to see these majestic peaks up close and to be at the top of the world, without climbing during an hour long scenic flight over the Himalayas.Your trip to Scenic Everest Experience Mountain Flight tour begins with pick up you from your accommodation in Kathmandu and will take you to Airport for the flight to Everest. To the north of Nepal are the celestial chains of mountains that sit as a crown and amidst it lies the gem of the Himalayas, Mt Everest. The mountain flight offers the opportunity to see these majestic peaks up close and to be at the top of the world, without the climb. During a 1 hour-long scenic flight, enjoy the sublime view of the mountains while listening to the narration provided onboard by the pilot about the names and spiritual significance of these various submits.Â

Desc: Trip Highlights: Traverse through the remote villages around Manaslu, 7th highest mountain in the world. Cross the high pass of Larkya La(5,125m). Explore the vast cultural and geographic diversity in remote Buddhist villages. The exceptional natural and scenic beauty blended with the warm and welcoming hospitality of the ethnic people. An amazing experience of being closest to the stunning snow-capped mountains. Manaslu is the eighth highest peak in the world that stands at an altitude of 8,163m/26,781ft and lies in Gorkha district. Â The area is protected by Manaslu Conservation Area Project (MCAP).Â Manaslu trekÂ with Larkya La Pass is one of the remote Treking sites in Nepal.Â  The trek goes aroundÂ Mount ManasluÂ and farthest tillÂ Manaslu base campÂ and Larkya La Pass.Â Larkya La Pass is the longest pass in Nepal and is also situated at high altitude. P_Name: Everest Base Camp Trek From Kathmandu, Nepal
Desc: Nepal, Everest Base Camp Trek, Itâ€™s nearly everyoneâ€™s dream to someday see the worldâ€™s tallest mountain. Situated in eastern Nepal, Mt. Everest casts a long shadow over the surrounding countryside. Its majestic presence leaves everyone in awe as they gaze upon its stark beauty. Himalayan Advisor is pleased to offer this 13 night/14 day journey to the roof of the world. Mt. Everest is surrounded by some equally magnificent peaks whoâ€™s summits rank as some of the highest mountains in the world. Himalayan Advisor may offer some of the lowest prices in the industry, but certainly do not skimp on quality or service. This is a full trek that takes you to the top of the world and back where you enjoy awe-inspiring views as well as friendly, local culture. If you have always wanted to see Mt. Everest, then now is the time. And Himalayan Advisor will make it possible to accomplish. Â DAY 1 â€“ FLY TO LUKLA toÂ Â (elev. 2860 m/9,383 ft.)TOÂ BENGKAR (elev 2835m)Â We fly the first day to the gateway to the Everest Region: Lukla. Here the famed airport has been constructed to allow small planes to land.Â DAY 2 â€“ TREK TO NAMCHE BAZAR (elev. 3500 m/11,483 ft.)Â Namche Bazar is the district village of the Everest region. Built into the side of a hill like an Amphitheatre,DAY 3â€“ ACCLIMATIZATION DAY .Weâ€™ve reached Khumjung Village our bodies to acclimatize to the high elevation. It wonâ€™t be a day of just sitting around as we go to Khumjung Village as well as Everest View Hotel (elev. 3780 m/DAY 4 â€“ TREK TO TENGBOCHE (elev. 3870 m/12,697 ft.).Â We say goodbye to Namche Bazar.DAY 5 â€“ TREK TO DINGBOCHE (elev. 4530 m/14,862 ft.).Â We are climbing more and more today as we make our way to the beautiful little village of Dingboche. It takes us around 5 â€“ 6 hours to reach Dingboche where we will spend the night.DAY 6 â€“ SECOND ACCLIMATIZATION DAY.Â We have reached another milestone in elevation as weâ€™ve crossed the 4500 meter mark.Â DAY 7 â€“ TREK TO DUGHLA (elev. 4600 m/15,092 ft.).Â This time, we are heading to the tiny little village of Dughla. Itâ€™s about a 3 â€“ 4 hour trek.Â DAY 8 â€“ TREK TO LOBUCHE (elev. 4940 m/16,207 ft.)Â We rise to watch the sun rise over the peaks of the Khumbu region. We have reached a very high elevation where hardly anything but low. shrubs grow. We are in the shadow of the ever present Khumbu Glacier. Everywhere we look at snowcapped peaks.Â DAY 9 â€“ TREK TO GORAKSHEP (elev. 5170 m/16,961 ft) VISIT EBC (elev. 5364 m/17,598 ft.).Â We are reaching our destination today of Everest Base Camp (EBC). This is the jumping off point that Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay began their epic journey to the top of the mountain in 1953.Â  Â It is around 6 â€“ 7 hours of Treking today.DAY 10 â€“ CLIMB MT. KALAPATHAR (elev 5545 m/18,192 ft.), TREK TO PHERICHE (elev. 4288 m/14,068 ft.).Â We rise early and climb to the top of Mt. Kalapathar. We return back to GorakshepÂ  We will spend the night in Pheriche after spending 7 â€“ 8 hours on the trail.DAY 11 â€“ TREK TO NAMCHE BAZAR (elev. 3500 m/11,483 ft.).Â We return today to Namche Bazar. Treking time is 7 â€“ 8 hours.DAY 12 â€“ TREK TO LUKLA (elev. 2860 m/9,383 ft.).Â Â We meet up once again with the Dudh Khosi River in the jungles of the region. Itâ€™s about a 7-8 hour walk today.DAY 13 â€“ FLY TO KATHMANDU.Â

Desc: Nagarkot sunset or sunrise hikingÂ Â is a good sampler for those who have not trekked before. It offers interesting temples, great views of the Kathmandu Valley, panoramic views of the mountains and even a glimpse of Everest. A visit to this area can be easily extended by a few days for those who would like to explore the region in more depth. Nagarkot 2170m is an quiet and scenic hilltop about 32 km from Kathmandu, very popular as a mountainÂ  and sunrise view point.You can see the panorama of the himalayas from Nagarkot.The sunrise and sunset on himalayas seen from this hill will be a life time memory for many.The 4 hour hike starts at the Newari town of Sankhu. We pass the uphill trail through scattered villages and farmlands and reach Nagarkot early afternoon. you can relax at Nagarkot till evening. you will drive bank to Kathmandu after see sunset from Nagarkot tower.
